alert.note: Alert for Lower Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Terrebonne Parish through 515 PM CDT... At 444 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over coastal waters 13 miles west of Cocodrie, or 28 miles south of Houma, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Terrebonne Parish. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
